channel.title: divisibility on Notes

item.title: MATH102-lecture-20220127
item.description: The language of divisibility # The following 7 statements are equivalent: 18 is divisible by 6 18 is a multiple of 6 6 is a factor or divisor of 18 6 goes into 18, or 6 divides 18 \( \frac{18}{6} \) is a whole number 18 is equal to 6 times a whole number, which is the same as saying there is \( 18 = 6k \) for some \( k \in \mathbb{Z} \) In the long division of 18 by 6, the remainder is 0.
